CatDescriptText: Mr. Donville Scott, floor waxer, 1408 Brighton Place and Mr. Bob Adams, clerk, 408 Standford Street, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper December 19, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that President Eisenhower is as popular today as he was when he first was when he first took office?  Why?  Do you think that the fact that he is not running for office will influence the election?"  Mr. Donville Scott's answer reads: "He is... He's doing a lot to help foreign countries.  Without Eisenhower as a candidate I think that the Democrats will have a better chance."  Mr. Bob Adams' answer reads: "Yes and the popularity is because he's a good boy.  I don't think his not running will have any influences."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Donville Scott wearing dark jacket covered in raindrops, dark zippered jacket with collar, light colored sweater, plaid button down collared shirt, and dark cap, standing next to stone block wall; Portrait of Bob Adams wearing button down collared coat, light colored button down collared shirt, and dark necktie, standing on sidewalk with buildings and pedestrian in background
